about_the_game:
In The veil of the forgotten, you wake up on the Isle of the Forgotten, a place where suffocating darkness engulfs everything, and shadows hide secrets. With the help of torches, you must light the way, ignite the light posts to escape the gloom, and search for the keys that unlock doors to the unknown. But you won’t be alone: something lurks in every corner, and SHE watches from the shadows, mocking your every misstep and waiting for you to succumb to the pressure.
Explore the island, face its dangers, and survive the constant tests of physical and mental endurance. The light is your only ally in this place where every decision counts and the darkness can be lethal. Do you have the courage to face the Isle of the Forgotten and uncover the secrets it hides?

Main Features

  • Exploration of a sinister island: The island is submerged in shadows and mysteries. Every corner hides dangers that stalk you, but also the tools you need to survive.
  • Torches to light the way: Collect torches and use them to light the posts that protect you from the suffocating darkness and guide you to the keys needed to open doors.
  • Puzzles: Obtain the keys by exploring the island and its hidden places, solving challenges to acquire them.
  • Darkness Guardians: Lethal shadows watch and are ready to attack. Stay in the light if you want to survive.
  • SHE: You won't be alone... SHE will talk to you, help you, despise you, and follow your every step, making your journey psychologically intense. Her comments will make you doubt every decision.

What Can You Expect?

  • A dark and oppressive atmosphere that keeps you in constant tension.
  • A journey full of dangers, with threats lurking in every shadow.
  • An engaging and mysterious story, where the keys to your survival are hidden in every corner.
  • Unique mechanics based on light and darkness, where light is your only defense.

Can You Escape?

SHE is watching you, and your movements may not be enough. Are you ready to face the horrors hidden in the Isle of the Forgotten? Or, as she says, will you be too slow, clumsy, and insignificant to succeed?
